apache 2.0.63 post multipart/form-data bug:

1. form as follows:

<FORM ACTION='404x.html' METHOD='post' ENCTYPE='multipart/form-data' id=\"theform\" >
<INPUT TYPE='file' NAME='file' 
<INPUT TYPE='hidden' NAME='action' VALUE='Upload'>
</form>

the 404x.html not exist,select  file larger than 500MB upload,then submit to 404x.html use ENCTYPE='multipart/form-data' ,bug:apache must self process all post data(may be 5 min), apache slowness report 404 error.

2.form as follows:

<FORM ACTION='cgiupload.pl' METHOD='post' ENCTYPE='multipart/form-data' id=\"theform\" >
<INPUT TYPE='file' NAME='file' 
<INPUT TYPE='hidden' NAME='action' VALUE='Upload'>
</form>

the cgiupload.pl is right.cgiupload.pl limit upload 100kb ,select  file larger than 500MB upload,then submit to cgiupload.pl use ENCTYPE='multipart/form-data' ,bug:apache must self process all post data(may be 5 min), CGI script  slowness report upload limit 100kb.

text: Apache reads and discards POST data when it's reporting an error, because otherwise many clients will never read the error. Are you describing something other than this?
